questions.question_text: Check whether the following are quadratic equations: (i) (x + 1)² = 2(x – 3) (ii) x² – 2x = (–2) (3 – x) (iii) (x – 2)(x + 1) = (x – 1)(x + 3) (iv) (x – 3)(2x +1) = x(x + 5) (v) (2x – 1)(x – 3) = (x + 5)(x – 1) (vi) x² + 3x + 1 = (x – 2)² (vii) (x + 2)³ = 2x (x² – 1) (viii) x³ – 4x² – x + 1 = (x – 2)³
hints: Expand both sides and simplify to standard form ax² + bx + c = 0
Check if highest power of x is 2 after simplification

questions.question_text: Represent the following situations in the form of quadratic equations: (i) The area of a rectangular plot is 528 m². The length of the plot (in metres) is one more than twice its breadth. We need to find the length and breadth of the plot. (ii) The product of two consecutive positive integers is 306. We need to find the integers. (iii) Rohan’s mother is 26 years older than him. The product of their ages (in years) 3 years from now will be 360. We would like to find Rohan’s present age. (iv) A train travels a distance of 480 km at a uniform speed. If the speed had been 8 km/h less, then it would have taken 3 hours more to cover the same distance. We need to find the speed of the train.
hints: Form equations based on given conditions

questions.question_text: Find the roots of the following quadratic equations by factorisation: (i) x² – 3x – 10 = 0 (ii) 2x² + x – 6 = 0 (iii) 2x² + 7x + 5√2 = 0 (iv) 2x² – x + 1/8 = 0 (v) 100x² – 20x + 1 = 0
hints: Group terms and factor common factors
Set each factor equal to zero

Find two consecutive positive integers, sum of whose squares is 365.

questions.question_text: The altitude of a right triangle is 7 cm less than its base. If the hypotenuse is 13 cm, find the other two sides.
hints: Let base = x cm, altitude = (x-7) cm

questions.question_text: A cottage industry produces a certain number of pottery articles in a day. It was observed on a particular day that the cost of production of each article (in rupees) was 3 more than twice the number of articles produced on that day. If the total cost of production on that day was ₹ 90, find the number of articles produced and the cost of each article.
Find the nature of the roots of the following quadratic equations. If the real roots exist, find them: (i) 2x² – 3x + 5 = 0 (ii) 3x² – 4√3 x + 4 = 0 (iii) 2x² – 6x + 3 = 0
hints: Determine nature based on D value
If D ≥ 0, find roots using formula or factorisation

questions.question_text: Find the values of k for each of the following quadratic equations, so that they have two equal roots. (i) 2x² + kx + 3 = 0 (ii) kx(x – 2) + 6 = 0
hints: Set D = 0 and solve for k

questions.question_text: Is it possible to design a rectangular mango grove whose length is twice its breadth, and the area is 800 m²? If so, find its length and breadth.
hints: Let breadth = x m, length = 2x m
Solve quadratic equation and check feasibility

questions.question_text: Is the following situation possible? If so, determine their present ages. The sum of the ages of two friends is 20 years. Four years ago, the product of their ages in years was 48.
hints: Let present ages be x and (20-x) years
Solve and check if roots are real and positive

questions.question_text: Is it possible to design a rectangular park of perimeter 80 m and area 400 m²? If so, find its length and breadth.
hints: Form quadratic equation and check discriminant
